meanings.definition: To surpass in cursing or swearing.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outcurse everyone in the room when she's angry.
meanings.sent2: He tried to outcurse his friend during the argument.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce as they tried to outcurse each other in the heat of the moment.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outcurse even the toughest individuals was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The way she could outcurse anyone made her a force to be reckoned with.

meanings.definition: To speak more profanely or vulgarly than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He tends to outcurse his friends without even realizing it.
meanings.sent2: During the movie, the characters would often try to outcurse each other for laughs.
meanings.sent3: It was a strange sight to see the usually quiet librarian outcurse the rowdy teenagers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of stand-up comedy, it's a challenge to outcurse the most seasoned comedians.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's ability to outcurse the audience while keeping them laughing was truly remarkable.
